dataIdInfo.idPurp: This file is a geocoded granule of [TYPE] SAR data from the Sentinel-1 mission. No terrain correction has been performed. The average elevation, as selected during the processing request, is [HEIGHT] m. Cell values indicate [POL] [POWERTYPE]-0 [FORMAT], and pixel spacing is [SPACING] m.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This file is a geocoded granule of [FULL_TYPE] ([TYPE]) Synthetic Aperture Radar data from the Copernicus Sentinel-1 mission (European Space Agency). It has been geocoded and projected into Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) coordinates, but no Radiometric Terrain Correction has been performed. As a result, the imagery may contain significant geolocation offsets in areas of high elevation. This data is most useful in areas of low topography, making it suitable for sea-ice studies.

In the filename, vv (hh) indicates the primary polarization, while vh (hv) indicates cross-polarization. To learn more about polarimetry, refer to https://sentinel.esa.int/web/sentinel/user-guides/sentinel-1-sar/product-overview/polarimetry

The name of the granule used to generate this TIFF file is: [GRAN_NAME]. For a detailed description of the Sentinel-1 file naming convention, refer to https://www.asf.alaska.edu/sentinel/data/#naming

Cell values indicate [POL] [POWERTYPE] nought [FORMAT], and pixel spacing is [SPACING] m. Because of the range of [FORMAT] values, the images may appear mostly black when first displayed. Consider setting the layer symbology to Stretched - Standard Deviations (choose a number (n) that works best for your particular dataset; the ArcGIS default of n: 2.5 will improve the display, but other values may give a better visualization).

For areas where there is a publicly-available digital elevation model, Radiometric Terrain Corrected products are also available from http://hyp3.asf.alaska.edu/

The Sentinel-1A satellite was launched April 3, 2014, and the Sentinel-1B satellite was launched April 25, 2016. The satellites each have a 12-day repeat cycle. More information about the mission is available at https://earth.esa.int/web/guest/missions/esa-operational-eo-missions/sentinel-1

Additional information about Sentinel-1 data, imagery, tools and applications is available at https://www.asf.alaska.edu/sentinel/
dataIdInfo.idCredit: ASF DAAC [YEARPROCESSED] using GAMMA software. Contains modified Copernicus Sentinel data [YEARACQUIRED], processed by ESA.

Consts.useLimit: There are no restrictions on the use of this data, but it must be cited as listed in the credits.

dataLineage.statement: This image was generated using ASF software wrappers driving Gamma SAR Software.
